result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvia A Colon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sylvia A Colon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sylvia A Colon in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State moves to amend count 1 to an ordinance DC violation.
Plea - Ct.1 - NC.
BTC: Ct.1 -GUILTY.   Ct.2 - DRI.
$100+cc, apply bond.
Status conference on June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:***4-28-15 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO ALLOW NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM RR, PARTIES MAY NOT DISCUSS THE CASE WHILE THE MATTER IS PENDING***  No contact with the victim, RR (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Sylvia A Colon in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
The victim is present this morning.
State would like a change to speak with the victim one more time.
Def moves to modify conditions of bond to lift the no contact order.
State does not object.
Victim would like the no contact order modified.
BTC: Modify conditions of bond to allow no violent contact with the victim, parties are not to discuss the case while the matter is pending. matter adjourned.
  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
It is Ordered that Patrick Cafferty be substituted as atty of record in place of Jennifer Severino.
Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorneys..forwarded to Judge Marik for review
Status conference on April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Sylvia A Colon in court.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
